Articles.Content:
I am soon going to start a new game on .22 and I want to have the best experience possible by adding mods so far I have these:

KAS

Kethane

Interstellar plugin

Extraplanetary Launch Pads

Near Future Propulsion

Lazor with all addons

Novapunch

KW rocketry

HOME (modified for .22)

Mechjeb

A few Bobcat Industries mods

B9

What mods should I add or remove

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/52159-PLUGIN-ALPHA-7-City-Lights-and-Clouds-on-Kerbin-Others

Adds clouds and city lights at night to kerbin. And if you got the computing power and ram to spare, Universe replacer is also a good mod.

It's always hard to suggest mods for others. You have most of the big ones there that I use, plus many I don't.

The only ones I consider needed that you don't have are Kerbal Alarm Clock, Enhanced Navball, and Navball Docking Indicator. I'd suggest Engineer but as you use MechJeb I suspect you don't need it.

It's always hard to suggest mods for others. You have most of the big ones there that I use, plus many I don't.

Yeah you're right but so I just want to know what good mods you use

/Shameless promotion of own mod.

No but seriously... Even if it's just for the added experiments...
